newsitem.title: USA: TVA restarts 1,065 MW Browns Ferry 3 unit.
newsitem.headline: TVA restarts 1,065 MW Browns Ferry 3 unit.

text.p: Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA) restarted its 1,065 megawatt (MW) Browns Ferry 3 nuclear power unit in Decatur, Ala., after repairs to a recirculation pump's motor generator, the utility said.
"They're pulling rods. They're restarting," said TVA spokesman Terry Johnson, adding the unit would contribute electricity to the regional grid later today.
"They're comfortable with what they found as the root cause (of the trip)," said Johnson.
Browns Ferry 3 was shut Sunday due to an electrical fault in the pump's motor generator.
Plant engineers concluded the failure was tied to an aging bus bar in the generator, he said.
TVA earlier said it take about three days to repair the problem.
Browns Ferry 3 is roughly equivalent to 2.8 percent of TVA's total generation capacity.
